author: Bamajon1974
body:
Does the Powershell included in Windows 10 as well as Powershell ISE versions need to be uninstalled or removed from Windows prior to installing v7? Or can all versions run simultaneously? 

Thanks!

comments.author: vexx32
comments.body: Versions 6 and above can all be installed side-by side with Windows PowerShell. 🙂

comments.author: Bamajon1974
comments.body: Got it. Is there any reason to keep the old versions of Powershell and Powershell ISE installed? I believe they are removed through the turn on/off optional components, right? If I uninstall the old versions in favor of v7, will anything in windows be broken?

comments.author: vexx32
comments.body:
Yeah, many windows components are reliant on v5 of PowerShell I'd guess.

I'm not really sure you actually _can_ uninstall it, tbh.

comments.author: Bamajon1974
comments.body: That is exactly what I wanted to know. I will leave the old PowerShell version. Thank you for your help!

comments.author: WSLUser
comments.body: You can remove the Optional version PS 2.0 and should as its a security vector. 5.1 should be the only version of Windows Powershell installed.

comments.author: Bamajon1974
comments.body: I am pretty sure v5.1 is the installed version of Powershell that wss included with the Win10 installation. Just to clarify, by v2, you mean an old version of powershell and not powershell ISE, correct?

comments.author: WSLUser
comments.body: Correct. Under Optional Features you will see it enabled. This is a bad Windows default, same with smb 2.0. Uncheck those and reboot. You'll still have ISE (though VS Code with PS extension is much better).

comments.author: Bamajon1974
comments.body: Ok. To clarify, I want to uncheck Powershell 2.0 and server message block 2.0 but keep powershell ISE, correct?

comments.author: msftbot[bot]
comments.body: This issue has been marked as answered and has not had any activity for **1 day**. It has been closed for housekeeping purposes.

title: Issues  label:Issue-Question  Uninstall Windows Powershell
